div.p: MOM: Jason, get off the phone, it's time for dinner. (to son) So, have you thought about how you're gonna pay for this?
MOTHER: Have you thought about maybe getting an attorney?
JASON: Hey, I'll represent you! Your honor, my client is totally guilty. And, he still owes me 50 bucks! And let me tell you what else...
MOTHER: Jason, be quiet, this is serious! You know you might lose your license?
MOTHER: What if you get jail time? Have you even thought about that?
MOTHER: Even if you just get probation, you're only 19, and you'll have a record. And you'll have to get drug tested, every month.
SON: I don't want this to mess anything up. Look, I'm gonna do everything I can to fight this, OK?
MOTHER: Well Hallelujah. Finally, the boy's got some sense. I'm gonna go call your Uncle Jim, see if maybe he'll represent you.
JASON: Seriously? Now all the sudden you care about the future?
SON: What I care about is making sure that nothing messes with my pot. Cause there's no way I'm giving up smoking.
